title: U.S. Futures, European Stocks Mixed
content:
U.S. futures for the S&P 500 were up 0.1% and futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average were flat. Changes in futures do not necessarily predict movements after the opening bell.

In Europe, the Stoxx Europe 600 gained 0.1% in morning trading. Embracer Group Series B rose 4.5% and Barry Callebaut added 2.6%. On the other hand, Sanofi dropped 8.8%, and D'Ieteren sunk 4.7%. The FTSE 100 was flat. Other stocks in Europe were mixed as France's CAC 40 declined 0.3% and Germany's DAX climbed 0.3%.

In commodities, Brent crude fell 1% to $66.92 a barrel, and WTI crude dropped 1% to $63.30 a barrel. The European benchmark price for natural gas, the Dutch futures contract TTF, was down 0.9% to 31.82 euros a megawatt hour. The German 10-year Bund yield fell by 2 basis points to 2.723% from 2.743%, and the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury declined by 1 basis point to 4.211% from 4.221%. Bond prices and yields move in opposite directions. Stocks in Asia were mixed as Japan's Nikkei 225 index gained 1.5%, whereas Hong Kong's Hang Seng dropped 1.1%. China's benchmark Shanghai Composite dropped 1.3%. -This article was automatically generated by MarketWatch.
summary: U.S. futures for the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average have risen by 0.1%, while European stocks were mixed. The Stoxx Europe 600 gained 0.5% and the FTSE 100 was flat. In other sectors, France's CAC 40 declined by 0.,3%, and Germany's DAX also rose by 0,3%. In other markets, Brent crude fell 1% to $66.92 a barrel and WTI crude dropped 1%. The German 10-year Bund yield fell by 2 basis points to 2.723%, while the 10-yr Treasury declined by 1 basis point to 4.11.
shortSummary: US, European, and Japanese stock markets were mixed as investors assessed the latest developments, with S&P 500, Dow Jones, and FTSE 100 indexes up slightly.
argos_summary: U.S. futures for the S&P 500 were up 0.1% and Dow futures were flat, while the Stoxx Europe 600 rose 0.1%. European stocks were mixed, with Embracer Group Series B up 4.5% and Sanofi down 8.8%. Commodities saw a 1% decline in Brent and WTI crude, and the German 10‑year Bund yield fell 2 basis points to 2.723%. The U.S. 10‑year Treasury yield slipped 1 basis point to 4.211%.
